title: `tau_exec` fails due to dynamic linker
body:
On macOS high sierra, with a clean spack install:
After installing `tau` from spack/develop, running:

```
spack load openmpi
spack load tau
tau_exec <executable_name>
```

### Expected Result

Program runs to completion

### Actual Result

results in the following error:

```
dyld: Symbol not found: __ZN3MPI3Win4FreeEv
  Referenced from: /Users/johannesblaschke/Developer/spack/opt/spack/darwin-highsierra-x86_64/gcc-8.2.0/tau-2.27.1-wzcsczxoes44cgmh6apzmt44t5wdwv3z/apple/lib/shared-communicators-phase-mpi-pdt-openmp/libTAU.dylib
  Expected in: flat namespace
 in /Users/johannesblaschke/Developer/spack/opt/spack/darwin-highsierra-x86_64/gcc-8.2.0/tau-2.27.1-wzcsczxoes44cgmh6apzmt44t5wdwv3z/apple/lib/shared-communicators-phase-mpi-pdt-openmp/libTAU.dylib
/Users/johannesblaschke/Developer/spack/opt/spack/darwin-highsierra-x86_64/gcc-8.2.0/tau-2.27.1-wzcsczxoes44cgmh6apzmt44t5wdwv3z/bin/tau_exec: line 1098:  4971 Abort trap: 6           $dryrun $@
```

even though `nm` shows that the symbol `__ZN3MPI3Win4FreeEv` exists in open mpi's lib-dir.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
checkout develop
$ spack install tau
$ spack load openmpi
$ spack load tau
```
(see above)


### Information on your system

 1. macOS high sierra 10.13.6
 2. packages compiled using gcc-8.0.2 (installed using homebrew)
